Developer Terms of Use
des:
Use Fleet Manager to control you Shelly devices.

IMPORTANT: This is NOT the Shelly Cloud skill and will NOT work with the Shelly Smart Control app.

You can now interact with Shelly Fleet Manager using Alexa voice commands as well as Alexa Smart Properties. If you do not have a Fleet Manager instance running you can request one from https://fleet.shelly.com/. If you are already registered you can follow this steps:
1. Enable the skill
2. You will be redirected automatically to a webpage from where you have to login to your account. 
3. Write the full address of your fleet manager instance as well your username and password.
4. When the Fleet Manager Skill is enabled, Your Amazon Alexa enabled device will scan for all new Shelly devices. 

You may need to rename your devices in the Shelly app in order for Alexa to recognize them more easily. In order to obtain better control performance, please specify a clear one word name for each device in the Shelly Cloud application like “Light”, “Coffee”, “Iron” and so on. 

After naming and discovering the Shelly device(s), you can control them using voice commands. For example, if you have a device named Lamp or a group named Bedroom, you can say things like: 

“Alexa, turn on the Lamp”
“Alexa, turn off the Lamp”
“Alexa, set Bedroom to warm white”
“Alexa, set Lamp to 30%”
“Alexa, what is the temperature of Bedroom?” 

Example of supported commands: 

Turn ON device using Alexa Skill 
“Alexa, turn on the [device name]”

Turn OFF device using Alexa Skill
“Alexa, turn off the [device name]”

You can use the skill with all Shelly gen 2 products or newer as long as they are supported in Fleet Manager.

If you have any questions or need help getting set up, please contact us at: support@shelly.cloud
